clues.text: Bats are mammals of the order Chiroptera, meaning "hand"-this
Nectar-feeding bats pollinate the flowers that grow on the tips of the organ pipe variety of this desert plant
Bats navigate at night using this system of acoustic orientation that incorporates nature's version of radar
Vampire bat bites threaten livestock not by making them the undead, but by spreading this disease caused by a lyssavirus
Each year as many as 20 million female Mexican free-tailed bats give birth at sites like Bracken Cave in this U.S. state
Thomas Jefferson's last public letter, 10 days before he died, says, sorry, too sick to attend the celebrations of its 50th anniversary
In 1855 she wrote a friend in England apologizing for not writing sooner but the Crimean War wounded were keeping her busy
In 1964 he wrote from Mecca that he had prayed with white people whose belief in Allah had "removed the 'white' from their minds"
In 1639 he wrote to Lord Huygens about his paintings with the "greatest & most natural movement" & mentioning "I live on the Inner Amstel"
A 1496 letter authorizes him & his son Sebastian to sail for England & claim isles, regions & "provinces of heathen & infidels"
In "Casablanca" Cuddles Sakall insists that the gambling at Rick's cafe is as this "as the day is long"
9-letter "cardiac" adjective for sincere apologies or sympathies
If I give you the straight scoop, I do this, the title of a 1966 Aaron Neville hit
It sounds like you just keep rising with this repetitive idiom that starts with "on the"
From the Latin, this word for sincere has a close relative, "genuine", & a "dis-" opposite
"Help" is a 2005 print by this man who played drums on "Help!" 40 years earlier
Andy Warhol's cover for The Velvet Underground's 1967 debut album featured one of these fruits with a peelable sticker
Lithographs by this late disco queen include "Jazzman" & "Hard for the Money"
For the cover of a 2019 album, this "Truth Hurts" singer posed nude against a simple black backdrop
She's painted the covers for many of her own albums, including "Ladies of the Canyon" & "Both Sides Now"
In 1959 methicillin was one of the first medications introduced to cope with bacteria resistant to these drugs
The A1C test measures average blood sugar over the past 3 months; at 5.7% you're pre-this, at 6.5 you're this
Iatrogenic is the term for a medical problem caused by the act of one of these, with maybe a lawsuit as a consequence

A patient is often put on a ventilator in a procedure called endotracheal
this -ation
Thomas Hodgkin's paper on "morbid appearances of the absorbent glands & spleen" described this type of cancer
A 15th century rule change transformed the weakest chess piece to this one, the strongest on the board
In 1990 this classic card game was included as part of Windows 3.0, turning millions of casual computer users into gamers

This card game scored with pegs on a board evolved from an earlier one called Noddy
In 2019 season 10 of this online survival game ended with a giant asteroid blowing up its virtual island, leaving a black hole

rounds.comments: (Ken: All the correct responses will come between those two words in the dictionary.)

clues.text: A rule by royals; Saudi Arabia has an absolute one
Buzzfeed examined "Why" this synonym for damp "is the Worst Word Ever"
This group of animals includes squid as well as shellfish
Angora goat fabric
It's Spanish for "young guy"
Withdrawing support from those who have erred in the eyes of the world leads to this alliterative phenomenon
Spectral phrase for the place to prepare food that is consumed elsewhere
This peanut butter & marshmallow creme sandwich has been around for a long time, but only made it into Merriam-Webster's in 2021
It's the 4-letter abbreviation for the pleasant tingling sensation that starts on the scalp in response to certain stimuli
This Danish concept comparable to coziness has become a U.S. trend; it includes good food, coffee & a warm place to gather

In a movie sequel:
"Yo, Adrian, I did it!"
In 2018: "I am not king of all people. I am king of Wakanda"

To Tom Cruise:
"Shut up, just shut up. You had me at hello"

In 2005:
"I wish I knew how to quit you"

Her in a 1950 classic:
"I am big, it's the pictures that got small"
G. Gordon Liddy's 1972 Gemstone plan included kidnapping & prostitutes; it was scaled back but a remaining part led to this scandal
In 1960 PM Ikeda planned to double Japan's national income by 1970, with annual this of 7.8%; it was 10% & income doubled early
Winfield Scott's Anaconda plan was to strangle the Confederacy by means of these efforts to stop up the enemy's ports

The 1791 plan for Washington, D.C. with diagonal axes over a more conventional grid was named for this Paris-born man
Let's Czech in with this capital where Smetana & Dvorak both lived
Originally, this city founded by King Harald was east of the Aker River but after a 1624 fire, ended up moving further west
Completed in the 1490s, Nydegg Church is a landmark in this city, capital of both its nation & its same-named Canton
Not Moscow but this capital 300 miles north of the Black Sea is the "mother of Rus cities"
Something to sink your teeth into... a signed document by Vlad the Impaler in 1459 is the first written appearance of this capital
Parade reported that taking this type of picture now causes "more deaths than shark attacks"

The name for this part of your nose comes from the Latin for "fence"
The Roman equivalent of this Greek goddess is Minerva
This yellow gastropod named for its resemblance to a fruit can move about 6 inches per minute

rounds.text: At her funeral in 1936, it was said that "The touch of her hand... literally emancipated a soul"
